content.description: Quite similar in style to Lava Sundae with the exception of a steep face section on crimps.  Great fun with a nicely exposed finish high on the wall.
Easy climbing on large holds leads to smaller holds and some crimping through a small overhang. The crux is negotiating the slight overhang that guards the anchors
content.location: The left-most route at the Dream Wall. The shorter line just left of "In the Flow"

content.description: This route is labeled as #4 - Project in the 2004 edition of Tieton River Rocks. It starts on a small precarious ledge to the right of the cave. A single bolt can be used to protect the belayer from a slip or fall. Climb through a balancy start which leads to good holds and a nice rest before the crux section(s). The first crux is an open book feature with a couple of good finger locks. Once you've made it through the open book, head right to climb over a roof using the crack and good jugs when you find them. Easier climbing leads to chain anchors.
content.location: This route starts on a small precarious ledge to the right of the cave. When approaching the dream wall, it is the first bolted route after Our Gang.

content.description: Easy movement on big holds through gently overhanging terrain. Easiest route at the Dream Wall
content.location: Directly to the right of Spanky

content.description: Jug-haul up to a shallow corner with some slopers and a crack.  Stem through the crux, gain the better part of the upper crack, and enjoy easier climbing to the finish in an alcove with a bolt just below the chains.
Wow.  Varied climbing through overhanging jugs, corners and some face moves on solid rock (with a few loose exceptions).  Best route at the Dream Wall.
content.location: Aim for a triangular roof high on the wall and end just below it

content.description: This route starts on what looks and feels like not quite vertical 5.9 terrain, sporting huge juggy lava holds pocketed with air bubbles. Soon enough you will find yourself on a ledge facing a flat black corner/face with few features.  Getting past this section leads to the crux, where you will pull some harder moves going left to follow the bolts. Next, a nice crack, some stemming and a mantle brings you to the chains. Great climb.
content.protection: 10 or so 'draws, anchors at the top.
content.location: At the start of Dream Wall, after walking past "Lost Socks.." (5.9) and "I.N.D.E.E.D." (10b), continue around the corner to an open area with beautiful black rock with a small cave in the corner. This climb starts on the left side of the small cave area. This route is found before descending down into the bushes towards Lava Sundae, Nothing Else Matters, etc.

content.description: Pull through the cave on great jugs, then continue up the overhanging wall on good holds.  Great body position.  Stick clip the first bolt.
content.location: Through the middle of the cave

content.description: Climb up to the roof.  Clip the chain hanging down from the lip.  Cut your feet loose and hang on tight.  If you step out left you're cheating!
content.location: Just right of Ring of Fire.  Climb straight through the obvious roof.

content.description: Tricky start, followed by jug hauling through steep terrain, wandering back and forth, past an old beehive, then traversing hard left before finishing in a slightly dirty corner.
content.location: Right end of the large cave, to the right of Ring of Fire

content.description: An easy start gives way to slightly steeper climbing on good holds
content.location: First climb on the way to the main wall

content.description: Nearly as good as Ring of Fire, with more juggy face moves and fewer corners.  The upper arete is great.
content.location: Heads up to the large block at the top of the cliff from the right

climbs.name: Joe and Stoney and the Great Rat Caper

content.description: Fun roof moves at the start bring you to a ledge.  Some tougher moves through the next section will get you to easier ground above.
content.location: To the right of Nothing Else Matters
